# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/win32-x64/lldb/lib/site-packages/pip/_vendor/urllib3/packages/six.py
@source-hash: 6fd2ccd30057bfb1
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:02:36Z

## Primary Purpose
Six library compatibility layer providing unified Python 2/3 APIs. Creates cross-version abstractions for moved/renamed modules, type handling, and common compatibility patterns. Core vendored dependency for urllib3.

## Version Detection & Type Constants (L36-77)
- `PY2`, `PY3`, `PY34` (L36-38): Boolean flags for version branching
- Platform-specific type tuples: `string_types`, `integer_types`, `class_types` (L40-53)
- `text_type`/`binary_type` abstractions (L44-53)
- `MAXSIZE` calculation with Jython/platform detection (L47-72)

## Lazy Loading Infrastructure
### `_LazyDescr` (L91-104)
Base descriptor for lazy attribute resolution. Self-removes after first access to avoid repeated computation.

### `MovedModule` (L107-124)
Lazy module importer that maps old→new module names based on Python version. Provides transparent attribute access delegation.

### `MovedAttribute` (L141-162)
Maps individual attributes/functions across Python versions with module+attribute name resolution.

### `_LazyModule` (L127-138)
Module type subclass supporting lazy attribute loading via `_moved_attributes` list.

## Import System Integration
### `_SixMetaPathImporter` (L165-237)
PEP 302 meta path importer for `six.moves` namespace:
- `find_module`/`find_spec` (L185-193): Module discovery
- `load_module` (L201-213): Dynamic module loading with fallback
- `is_package`/`get_code` (L215-231): Module metadata

## Core Moves Registry (L240-350)
- `_MovedItems` (L243-248): Central lazy module for all moved items
- `_moved_attributes` (L250-333): Comprehensive mapping of Python 2→3 changes
  - Built-in functions (filter, map, range, etc.)
  - Standard library modules (urllib, ConfigParser, etc.)
  - Platform-specific additions (winreg on Windows)
- `moves` global (L348): Public interface to moved items

## Urllib Compatibility Modules (L352-541)
Specialized lazy modules for urllib reorganization:
- `Module_six_moves_urllib_parse` (L352-396): URL parsing functions
- `Module_six_moves_urllib_error` (L399-419): Exception classes  
- `Module_six_moves_urllib_request` (L422-474): HTTP request handling
- `Module_six_moves_urllib_response` (L477-498): Response objects
- `Module_six_moves_urllib_robotparser` (L501-521): robots.txt parsing
- `Module_six_moves_urllib` (L524-541): Unified urllib namespace

## Function/Method Compatibility (L560-635)
Cross-version attribute name mappings for introspection:
- Method attributes: `_meth_func`/`_meth_self` (L560-570)
- Function attributes: `_func_*` constants (L564-575)
- Accessor functions using `operator.attrgetter` (L629-634)

## Print Function (L814-884)
Comprehensive Python 2 print statement → function compatibility with encoding, separators, and file output handling.

## Advanced Compatibility (L888-1050)
- `_update_wrapper`/`wraps` (L894-926): functools backport for Python < 3.4
- `with_metaclass` (L929-950): Metaclass creation helper

Package initialization and meta path importer registration with cleanup of duplicate importers.

## Key Dependencies
- `functools`, `itertools`, `operator`, `sys`, `types`: Core Python modules
- Self-contained with no external dependencies

## Architectural Patterns
- Lazy loading with descriptor protocol
- Version detection through `sys.version_info` branching  
- Import hook system for transparent module aliasing
- Decorator pattern for class/function transformation
